author: {'steamid': '76561197968016843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1439290108}
review:
Pro:
- Availability of an actual Mahjong game that isn't Mahjong solitaire.

Con:
- One of the worst Mahjong games I've ever played.
- Not beginners friendly.
- Not intermediates friendly.
- Not all text is translated.

Either pro or con:
- For a game that features "pretty girls," there is a surprising lack of substance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031707244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1540328233}
review:
Some people mentioned the Saki Anime and many of the ways to win are extactly like what went on during that anime, LOL, anyone remember  "Bottom of the Sea"  well its in this game.
I can say that for what is there the game works flawlessly, but many other things are there that are not implemented.
You definitely need to know how to play, Japanese style Mahjong or this is a no buy for you.  If you understand the game but are still relatively new to a moderate player with Japanese Mahjong, you will have fun playing this. if you are advanced and would be happy with the girls, probably. But if your looking for a serious high quality game, this is not it.  But then the introductory price already told You that information.
Thanks to Zoo and Steam for finally releasing a "real" mahjong game on Steam 
I will recommend this game based on my caveats above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005143432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1468322465}
review:
My unbiased opnion: This is not worth money.

My biased opinion: It's horrible.

The girls say 2 and a half words then they're about to win and when they win.

As someone who likes anime girls and mahjong:

If you like games with anime girls, this is not for you.
If you like Mahjong, you're better off playing any other game. Even just a web-browser mahjong game. 

The UI, the translation and the voice acting all reek of cheap and lazy. 

tl;dr: Don't pay for it. Looks worse than a flash game from 1998.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025524239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1591585237}
review:
This game is about 95% japanese mahjong and 5% busty anime babes. This game is good if you already know how to play japanese mahjong and understand the rules and hands. If you don't know how to play and you are buying the game for the girls, you will be disappointed. I was not disappointed though! I enjoy playing japanese mahjong, so playing against cute girls and hearing cute girl voices only enhances it. Now I just really want to win more so I can unlock more girls.
It's a little buggy and the translation is a little silly but nothing that really stops me from playing the game. I agree it would be a lot better if we could do multiplayer!! 
8/10 for a japanese mahjong game

author: {'steamid': '76561197969418821', 'num_games_owned': 3864, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1555727266}
review:
First of all, the game gives an error when starting the game, but it continues to run. If I go into the options menu however, I get a DirectX error, and it crashes the game completely. It's still fully playable though, I just can't see what options there are.

It's four player mahjong, and moves at a satisfyingly fast pace. I say this because a lot of four player mahjong video games are excrutiatingly slow. 

The default setting in this game is for four rounds (east only), rather than the eight (east and south) or sixteen (east, south, west, north) variants you usually get in these games, so games fly by really quickly.

The sound effects are great, and to summarise, the actual mahjong gameplay part is fun!

---

Unfortunately... there's not much else to say about the game other than things that can be perceived as downsides.

- When you lose, it dumps you back to the title menu.

- When you WIN, it dumps you back to the title menu.

- There's no kind of 'reward art' that tends to be common in these kinds of games.

- There's no character dialogue or in-between-game scenes, just different voices during the mahjong gameplay.

- Characters unlock on an achievement basis, ie. 'Win 100 games!' or 'Win 5 games as this character!' This isn't bad in itself, but when it's the only thing in the game to work towards (getting different voice samples and a character icon), it's not too motivating. 

- It's single player only, but honestly, that's usually the norm for these kinds of anime-themed mahjong games... except all the other single player mahjong games usually have a storyline, dialogue, reward art, endings, occasionally heart meters, and so on. This game has none of those.

In short, it's great for a ten minute burst of polished fast-paced mahjong gameplay, but don't expect anything more than that. There's no goal to aim for other than unlocking all the characters, and those characters are nothing more than a single picture when choosing them on the character select screen, and then you never see them again.

Purely because it's the only way to play mahjong in English on Steam, and the gameplay part is solid, I'm clicking 'Recommended' for this!  But if you are able to play Japanese console games, there are hundreds of better titles out there in this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971101812', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1450647551}
review:
UPDATE: No one should buy this now, https://mahjongsoul.yo-star.com/


---THIS GAME IS FOR HARDCORE MAHJONG PLAYERS ONLY---

If you are not familiar with how Ricchi Mahjong is played this game WILL NOT TEACH YOU HOW TO PLAY IT. 

The game is Mahjong, the bass techno music is horrible but beside the sound... its mahjong thatâ€™s it. If you want to play Riichi Mahjong on your PC/Steam then this is the game, and the ONLY game to get. (You can get the Japanese tenhou client and play mahjong on your PC that way but... tenhou requires some work the complex UI can be intimidating as everything is in Japanese and is filled with bots, its mainly for and used by the Japanese and Chinese community) 

If you're expecting something fancy then you've come to wrong place. The translation is absolutely horrible, nothing makes sense in English, I've just turned the UI into Japanese because now I'm not going get annoyed from the engirishi. 

The feel of the actual play, the game play is nice, itâ€™s what to be expected from a Mahjong game released on Steam by one of the big Japanese companies, itâ€™s just very sad that the game is singe-player only and there are no current talks or plans for online support.

 With all that said the game supports a huge roaster of characters, you only have 4 unlocks at first the rest are unlocked by your progression. Hmâ€¦ well yeah thatâ€™s sums it up I guess, worth mentioning that some users are reporting issues with the game (crashes, missing graphical objects) you might want to wait before making a purchase although it seems the developer of the game is active on the Steam forums so I guess they're on it and chances are these issues are going to handled quite nicely. 

UPDATE:  http://steamcommunity.com/games/338060/announcements/detail/243527024526691800

Running on Win7 64bit 8Gb Ram 1600X900 5850HD Graphics.  

EDIT: A lot of people seem to be confused on what this game actually is, there are no hot anime chicks in this game, you don't talk to anyone, they don't say anything, its JUST Mahjong. With the addition of anime cardboard box cutouts as your opponents whom are almost NEVER ON SCREEN. (They show up to say Pon ,Ron, Kan, Chi, for a MICRO SECOND during the game, you're also shown the cardboard box image of the winning character at the after game score screen) 

I would personally give this game a +12 rating for its sexually? suggesting cardboard box cutout anime girls, that's it, it wouldn't even qualify for a +15 rating. 

PS. If youâ€™re interested in learning Riichi Mahjong I highly recommend you to watch this 4 part series. 

Iâ€™ll put the link for the first part here.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mh0brmqq4sk

Enjoy

You better look and memorize these as well.  

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Mahjong_yaku
